channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Branch near kissing gate obstructing PROW at head height, 23rd November
item.description:
The PROW around the back of the Gotherington infant/junior school. Branch near kissing gate obstructing PROW at head height and other bramble. Whole path around the school could do with a trim and cleanup leaves etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Lawns, Gotherington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling manhole cover, 23rd November
item.description:
Manhole cover outside number 4 Gloucester Street. Issue has got worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Northbound from Stow Court to Malvern Road, 23rd November
item.description:
The north bound section from aproximately Stow Court to Malvern road is absolutely lethal for cyclists. Riding on the left hand side anywhere near the kerb is dangerous due to the current pot holes, the previous bad patching of pot holes and bad resurfacing. Please have someone attempt the ride on a cycle to experience it. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large part of road tarmac missing and deteriorating., 23rd November
item.description:
Outside 8 New Barn Close and on other locations in that close. As the road is narrow traffic has to constantly drive across the long pothole which is deteriorating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, New Barn Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No dropped curb! Canâ€™t use in wheelchair, 23rd November
item.description:
This street, and many others of North Upton Lane do not have drop curbs, and therefore I cannot travel on my wheelchair from Abbeymead to Hucclecote. It is very frustrating when, in this day and age, there are not drop curbs on roads. I have a new wheelchair, but I feel I cannot go out as most of the pavements are inaccessible to me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Upton Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven and damaged pavements both sides of Longlands Road - needs re-tarmacing, 23rd November
item.description:
The length of Longlands Road. Poor state of repair. Need re-tarmacing urgenty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longlands Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Lack of lighting for pedestrians, 23rd November
item.description:
There is lack of lighting in this area for pedestrian particularly in the Winter months. Is there a chance of implementing some motion sensor/reactive lights for this stretch? Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Cleevemount Road, Prestbury, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 23rd November
item.description:
email rec 21/11/2023 email trail attached
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Continual Flooding of Leckhampton road footpath, 23rd November
item.description:
I notice today that you are putting in a new surface on the path in Mornington Drive, which is little used, but nothing is done along Leckhampton road, from approx Halland Road to the Norwood. When it rains it's now virtually impossible to walk along the path and you either have to cross the road or walk in the road. I know its difficult as the path is below the road, and it has lots of tree roots, and you have cleaned some drains, but its beyond a joke and needs a solution before somebody gets knocked down walking on the road. I have sent a selection of photos which I took in the summer, but can send more as it happens every time we get more than drizzle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking and broken slabs on a narrow stretch of pavement on Montpellier Walk outside The Ivy/Harry Cook and further along outside AllBarOne, 23rd November
item.description:
The paving slabs are broken and rock when stepped on, which could easily result in tripping up a pedestrian. There is nowhere else to walk except for the road as the walkway is so narrow at this point

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 23rd November
item.description:
Bridge structure and vegetation issues for this PROW, Please see email and photos attached
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole has formed due to very poor road condition, 23rd November
item.description:
The awful road condition at the pedestrian crossing has caused such erosion that a large, deep pothole has now formed. Please can this be fixed, this is a main route through the village and has been getting worse and worse and being ignored!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders skip blocks pavement outside #8 Hartley Close GL53 for the past 4 months, 23rd November
item.description:
Pavement obstructed outside #8 by overflowing builders skip for past 4 months. In addition the contents are not secured and blow over the road and pavement,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Hartley Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken glass bottle on path, 22nd November
item.description:
There is a smashed glass bottle on the path which is very dangerous to animals. Please can it be cleaned up? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed limit sign obliterated, 22nd November
item.description:
The 50mph speed limit sign on the right hand side of the road as you come up to the roundabout is very dirty and covered in vegetation. You can't actually read it. Could this please be cleaned? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings completely faded, 22nd November
item.description:
The markings for the two lanes have completely faded which causes issues as vehicles go straight on in both the left hand and right hand lane. Please could they be repainted?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Multiple potholes on Malleson Road from A435 all the way to Prestbury, 22nd November
item.description:
Condition of Malleson road appalling. So many potholes forcing drivers to drive dangerously in the middle of the road. Waiting till February 2024 for this long overdue re surfacing is too late, this needs to be urgently re surfaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
